attributes.action: Stop discriminating against young Adult students unable to access Higher Education, Maintenance, EMA grants
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The English government classes people of 16 as Adults - they can leave school, work full time, have a baby, get married, leave home, etc. At 18 there they have no restrictions. 

Students, aged 18, going to University:
- Spend at least £28,000 for 3 years full time study away from home
- Normally funded by student loans
- Government's lesson is - build up horrendous debts from 18, and don't worry, repayments are deferred while interest grows at the rate of inflation. 

Some students receive grants:
- Maintenance Grants of £2,765, and £1,000 Higher Education Grant
- They could live at home and complete a degree with loans or debt
- The student does nothing, except attend, to be eligible
- Their parents earn less than £16,340

Other students receive no grant at all:
- What have these Adults done to deserve exclusion and discrimination? Nothing! 
- Their parents earn above £38,330

At College, some students aged 16 & 17:
- Receive £30 per week EMA just to attend
- Most live at home, near the college
- Most spend the grant on enjoyment (80% on cigarettes)
- Receive nothing if parents earn above £30,810.

These people are Adults and should be assessed independently from their parents income.
